/* Available forms */[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], typos fixed: chinese → Chinese, english → English using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
Citations: [178] added: doi, journal, volume. Tweaked: year, pages. [[User:Edgar181|Edgar181]]
/* Solubility in water */ @Scray you're right though so I'll leave it like this.
/* Solubility in water */ @Scray in fact Tylenol hardly supersaturates. This was noticed during CWE (cold water extractions) where cooling a saturated solution forms a white precipitate.
/* Solubility in water */ @Scray, Quite pertinent observation, that's why I didn't give a precise value. I think supersaturation affects more the very soluble solutes like sugar...but you're right.
/* Solubility in water */ lacking a [[WP:RS|reliable source]], this seems likely to be [[WP:SYN|synthesis]] or [[WP:OR|original research]]. Couldn't it supersaturate, for example?
Changed solubility from 14 to 12.78, see study: http://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/je990124v
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/60.240.29.158|60.240.29.158]] ([[User talk:60.240.29.158|talk]]) to last revision by Raeky ([[WP:HG|HG]])

/* Available forms */ Added Chinese form, short details and picture

/* History */ Using page of aspirin as citation for aspirin
/* Available forms */ cleanup ref - does not work if you have whitespace in title other than a space.

/* Available forms */ - US FDA considers reducing daily dose recommendation because of the fact that Acetaminophen is still related to many cases of acute liver toxicity. Ref to FDA which reffed NEJM.
/* Available forms */ rock bands are popular, medications are widely used

You just don't get it, do you? I am not the only one that disagrees with having your images in the articles. Accept the decision and get over it.
Undid revision 370340820 by [[Special:Contributions/Xent0r0|Xent0r0]] ([[User talk:Xent0r0|talk]]) - Generic drug photo is VITAL to the article and is not vandalism. There is a "Panadol" article.
Undid revision 370322709 by [[Special:Contributions/Editor182|Editor182]] ([[User talk:Editor182|talk]]) - Dispute is under Discussion. Do not change until discussion is over. To do so is vandalism.
Undid revision 370260537 by [[Special:Contributions/Kristoferb|Kristoferb]] ([[User talk:Kristoferb|talk]]) Nobody is anybodies puppet, your conflict of interest is affecting the quality of articles.
Undid revision 370259164 by [[Special:Contributions/NuclearWarfare|NuclearWarfare]] ([[User talk:NuclearWarfare|talk]]) - NuclearWarfare is puppet for Editor182 - REVERT VANDALISM
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Kristoferb|Kristoferb]] ([[User talk:Kristoferb|talk]]) to last version by Editor182
Undid revision 370245093 - Image is in English REVERT VANDALISM
This Wikipedia is written in English. This image does not contribute to the English version of Wikipedia. Many other Wikipedias are available.
Undid revision 370235707 - why add this to the History section?
I am going to compromise, I'll move the Panadol Rapid to a different section, but coming in with your generic images and putting them on top of or replacing brand name images is simply unjustifiable.
Undid revision 370233549 - There is no reason to have two Panadol images in the first place. And, moreover, no reason to move the generic from where the article talks about generics in detail.
The generic image is moved to a different section of the article, it has not been removed, as I've said before, the Panadol images are being put together, but I am not removing your generic.
Undid revision 370232882 - Article is on the GENERIC DRUG. The image I replaced yours with is both better quality and more in line with the topic, given it is a generic vs. two images of same brand.

I'm not removing the generic, there is no room or purpose for the generic to be in the section of which you replaced it, the Panadol formulations are in context. Stop all the unjustifiable reversions.
Undid revision 370231270 - It is not better. Your images are poor quality and there is already an article on Panadol. Put your photo in that article and leave the generic in the article on the generi
I never said it was, generics are welcome and I did not remove it, but please stop removing the Panadol image from the relevant section, the generic goes better where it is.
Undid revision 370230461 by vandalism by Editor182 - Article is NOT ON THE BRAND PANADOL.
I have no problem with you adding generic versions of the drug, but do not remove or displace the brand name versions that are already present in the article.
Undid revision 370229867 by vandalism by Editor182 - Forms includes brand vs. generic; the article is on Paracetamol and NOT the brand Panadol.
The Panadol images are of the tablets and caplets, which are different forms, which is why they're placed under "Available forms". Generics are more than welcome, but don't remove or displace others.
Undid image vandalism - Editor182 keeps replacing good images with his poor ones. Article is on generic paracetamol, not the brand ''Panadol", thus no need for two poor quality images of that brand.
Moving Korean generic drug to "Efficiency and side effects", please do not separate or remove the Panadol or Panadol Rapid images.
